product_description: Palermo is a beautiful, luxe, printable velvet base cloth in a cream tone with an irregular pile.
recyclable_percentage_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recyclable_offcuts_description: This product can be recycled through various programs in Australia, such as TRAKS, as long as it is uncontaminated i.e. no staples, hooks or adhesives.
recycling_process_description: We recycle unusable offcuts with onshore Textile Recyclers Group where it is made back into recycled yarn
water_reduction_techniques: Our digital print facilities uses little to no water.
minimisation_design_strategy: We print on demand so there is very little wastage. What can be reused is picked up by our local charity partners. And we have a recycling program with Coritex for any unusable waste which is shredded to make mattresses at Sealy's shoddy factory.
factory_finished_description: Printing of designs onto the textile substrate involves dye sublimation, the initial stage of which is printing the design onto FSC certified paper, using OEKO-TEX ECO PASSPORT certified inks.

factory_finished_description: Made from 100% virgin wool, Blazer is natural and renewable. Suitable for soft seating, task seating, screens and panels.

product_description: A versatile, heavy-duty crepe upholstery textile made from 100% solid-coloured Australian wool
recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed, mains and recirculated water.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Textile weaving and dyeing are carried out in a vertical facility, and the distance from the final manufacturing stage to the port is under 15km, both of which significantly minimise transport emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the wool and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are prevalent in wool textile supply chains, and can include exploitative labour practices such as forced labour and inadequate working conditions during wool shearing and processing, particularly in countries with weak labour laws. However, these risks are low in Australia due to strict labour laws and regulations ensuring fair treatment and wages for workers.
other_comments: The majority of Instyle LIFE Sustainable Textiles are made locally in Australia or NZ, minimising transport kilometres. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

product_description: Sustainable Chelsea: 100% Australian Wool, Heavy Duty Commercial, GECA certified & Carbon Neutral
recyclable_percentage_description: Any fabric not fit for re-spinning including fabric attached to other elements such as glue will be shredded for use in upcycled products such roof tiles, insulation, office partitions and stuffing for pet beds.
recycling_process_description: Depending on the fabric and its condition, the fabrics will be recycled differently. Untarnished fabrics can be blended with virgin fibres to produce yarns ideal for manufacturing new fabrics.
end_of_life_program_description: The responsibility of disposing of used fabrics environmentally is up to our customers. The best solution is to provide our clients with legitimate options to dispose of our fabric through the emerging recycling channels now becoming available. By providing our customers with information, we hope it will spark the initiative to close the loop. We are excited to promote UPPAREL as a source for our clients to recycle their offcut fabric from production as well as end of life fabric from dismantled furniture.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of harvested rainwater, mains and recirculated water.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: ASSOCIATED EMISSIONS ARE CALCULATED AND CARBON OFFSET TO RENEWABLE FUEL PROJECTS
minimisation_design_strategy: ALL CONSULT WITH YOUR FURNITURE MANUFACTURER OR UPHOLSTERER AS THEY WILL BE ABLE TO GIVE YOU THE BEST ESTIMATE FOR YOR USAGE
factory_finished_description: NO
other_comments: Sustainable Chelsea is woven using 100% Australian Wool. It is a crepe weave in a solid colour, available in 81 different colourways. This designer fabric is rated Heavy Duty Commercial, it is made in Australia, is GECA certified and is certified Carbon Neutral. It is suitable for all upholstery applications.

product_description: A coarsely textured printable base cloth, waterproof backing, antimicrobial and OEKO-TEX certified
recyclable_percentage_description: Yes you can recycled polyester by partnering with companies such as Textile Recyclers Group (TRG) as we do
recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recycling_process_description: We recycled all of our polyester offcuts and sampling by partnering with Textile Recyclers Group at their recycling depot in Sydney. They recycle back into yarn.
water_reduction_techniques: At our printing facility in Sydney we use recycled water - and the whole digital and dye sublimation printing process uses very little water
minimisation_design_strategy: Designs can be railroaded which can help reduce offcuts for upholsterer but we print on demand so very little wastage
specific_installation_methods: No adhesives or staples
other_comments: To get a deeper understand of our sustainable printing processes and practices please visit https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores and soft clear plastic. Sometimes palletised depending on quantity.

minimisation_design_strategy: ALL CONSULT WITH YOUR FURNITURE MANUFACTURER OR UPHOLSTERER AS THEY WILL BE ABLE TO GIVE YOU THE BEST ESTIMATE FOR YOR USAGE
factory_finished_description: NO
other_comments: Sustainable Tekneko is woven using 60% Australian Wool and 40% Polyester. It is a jacquard weave in a two-tone colourway, available in 6 reversible colours. This designer fabric is rated Heavy Duty Commercial, it is made in Australia, is GECA certified and is certified Carbon Neutral. It is suitable for all upholstery applications.
type_of_packaging: SLF USE LOW FLAT TUBE PACKAGING WHICH IS NON HALOGENATED PLASTIC.  WE REUSE PLASTIC THAT COMES ON THE ROLLS FROM OUR FABRIC MILLS. WE TAKE BACK CARDBOARD TUBES FROM OUR CUSTOMERS.

product_description: A marle felt upholstery textile with a soft, luxurious touch made from Australian wool + alpaca
recyclable_percentage_description: The wool component of Instyle's LIFE Textiles is inherently renewable and biodegradable. All pure wool and wool-rich LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/.
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Production facility recycles approx. 250 cubic meters of cooling water daily.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the wool and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are prevalent in wool textile supply chains, and can include exploitative labour practices such as forced labour and inadequate working conditions during wool shearing and processing, particularly in countries with weak labour laws. However, these risks are low in Instyle's countries of manufacture due to strict labour laws and regulations ensuring fair treatment and wages for workers.
other_comments:
The production facility operates with over 80% renewable energy, complies with REACH standards for safety and environmental protection, and recycles approximately 250 cubic meters of cooling water daily.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

product_name: Crypton Aria Snow - Printable Base Cloth
product_description: Crypton Aria is a printable, durable velvet textile base cloth featuring a waterproof backing.
recyclable_percentage_description: We recycled all of our Crypton offcuts and sampling by partnering with Textile Recyclers Group at their recycling depot in Sydney. They recycle back into yarn.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Crypton maintains an ongoing recycling program of manufacturing remnants. And locally, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group). It would need to be the upholsterer / workroom that builds their own local partnership for this.
water_reduction_techniques: To print the design onto this base cloth in Sydney, we use the dye sublimation method which uses very little water. And we print on demand which reduces wastage. We also have rainwater tanks for other water usage at our print facility.
minimisation_design_strategy: Depending on the chosen print, a design can be printed railroaded to minimise wastage.
other_comments:
Yarn is most often bought on the spot market so we can only provide details of the country of manufacture i.e. where the base cloth is milled. And in the case of Crypton, we are only allowed to detail their Head Office and main mill in the US.
Crypton is a company very committed to sustainability. You can read their Eco Statement and see more information here: https://materialised.com.au/crypton-waterproof-fabric/
You can learn about our sustainability statement and practices here: https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/
This is a link to our internal Waste Warriors team, list of charities we donate to: https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/recycling-charities/
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores and clear plastic wrap. Pallets are used if the quantity is large.

product_description: A sophisticated, versatile, ADF + PFAS-free high performance indoor + outdoor vinyl
recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Vinyls and HP Textiles can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme, however conditions of return apply for these materials as there is currently no recycling capability for flexible bonded vinyls in Australia. Visit https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ for more information.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed and recirculated water.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the vinyl and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in PVC furnishing vinyl supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Instyle's manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding direct adhesive application to backing foam makes vinyls more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, vinyls should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Instyle's additive-free formulation for vinyls ensures these products are free from PFAS, phthalates, flame retardants, anti-bacterial additives, lead, BPA, TRIS, and formaldehyde, and do not contain conflict minerals. They meet international environmental, health, and safety standards, including California Prop 65, CPSIA, and REACH. Additionally, the formulation achieves reduced energy and water consumption and promotes waste recycling through the use of solution-dyed products. This is supported by our manufacturerâ€™s ISO 14001-certified Environmental Management System.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

other_comments: The majority of Instyle LIFE Sustainable Textiles are made locally in Australia or NZ, minimising transport kilometres. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

end_of_life_program_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is reused in the scouring process, and weaving mill incorporates 30% rain-fed water usage, with 100% of all water used purified before being returned to the aquifer.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Textile processing and weaving is carried out in a vertical facility, and the distance from the final manufacturing stage to the port is under 15km, both of which significantly minimise transport emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the wool and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Human rights and modern slavery risk are assessed as part of the Enviromark Diamond certification.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are prevalent in wool textile supply chains, and can include exploitative labour practices such as forced labour and inadequate working conditions during wool shearing and processing, particularly in countries with weak labour laws. However, these risks are low in Australia & New Zealand due to strict labour laws and regulations ensuring fair treatment and wages for workers.
other_comments: The majority of Instyle LIFE Sustainable Textiles are made locally in Australia or NZ, minimising transport kilometres. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recyclable_offcuts_description: Synthetic and High Performance textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: 100% Olefin fibre is capable of being recycled up to 10 times. However, Australia currently lacks onshore facilities for polypropylene fibre recycling, so end-of-life processing would need to be handled offshore. We are actively supporting initiatives for local recycling solutions that recapture value instead of limiting end-of-life pathways to downcycling to lower grade products.
end_of_life_program_description: Synthetic and High Performance textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: No water is used in the production of Mezzo yarn, however our manufacturing facility uses recycled water and harvested rainwater to reduce potable water use, recapturing 98% of water. Wastewater is purified and returned to local waterways. Dry treatments and efficient dyeing save over 25 million liters annually.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Extrusion, processing and weaving are carried out in a vertical facility, which significantly minimises transport emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the wool and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in synthetic textile supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Our manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While synthetic furnishing materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, OEKOâ€“TEX and Zero Discharge of Hazardous Chemicals Program compliant, however Olefin textiles can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
other_comments:
Olefinâ€™s production is exceptionally water-efficient, needing no water for yarn extrusion or dyeing. It is highly durable, with a 100-year life cycle, and features low thermal conductivity, chemical resistance, and natural mold and bacteria resistance.

No fossil fuels are used to heat the manufacturing facility as machine heat is repurposed to warm the building. All waste from yarn extrusion is upcycled into raw materials for the automotive and carpet industries.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

product_description: A chrome-free European leather with a beautiful soft handle and appearance

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Tannery uses a biological Water Treatment Plant, utilising 100% non-potable river water in a closed-loop process that purifies the water before returning it to the source.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific policies are in place to reduce transport emissions, however all hides are sourced regionally in Europe and processing is in a vertical facility which significantly reduces transport distance between hubs.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any leather, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise hide usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the leather and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are significant concerns in the leather supply chain, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labor laws. The Leather Working Group (LWG) provides a framework for auditing and certifying tanneries based on their adherence to social and environmental standards, helping to ensure responsible sourcing and production practices. By requiring compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, LWG certifications provide assurances of fair treatment for workers and efforts to mitigate toxic chemical use and environmental pollution. As global leaders in sustainable leather production, our European partner Elmo sets high standards to actively reducing risks and promote safe practices throughout the leather supply chain.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Elmo prioritises sustainability through several significant initiatives. Their "Zero Waste Leather" concept ensures that all production waste is upcycled, recycled, or reused, creating a circular economy with no waste sent to landfills. The Elmo Circular Operating model (ECO) enhances resource efficiency and reduces environmental impact by repurposing all process waste as raw materials or energy sources. Elmo has achieved CO2 neutrality in energy use by utilising 100% renewable electricity and biofuel-based steam for heating. They enhance sustainability further by implementing a circular heating energy approach, selling back the hot condensate generated from biofuel steam to the heating supplier, which reduces energy consumption in steam production. For more detailed information, you can visit their website.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Elmo prioritises sustainability through several significant initiatives. Their "Zero Waste Leather" concept ensures that all production waste is upcycled, recycled, or reused, creating a circular economy with no waste sent to landfills. The Elmo Circular Operating model (ECO) enhances resource efficiency and reduces environmental impact by repurposing all process waste as raw materials or energy sources. Elmo has achieved CO2 neutrality in energy use by utilising 100% renewable electricity and biofuel-based steam for heating. They enhance sustainability further by implementing a circular heating energy approach, selling back the hot condensate generated from biofuel steam to the heating supplier, which reduces energy consumption in steam production. For more detailed information, you can visit their website.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic Felt fabric is not designed for disassembly; however, it still aligns with Instyleâ€™s commitment to material efficiency. water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed and recirculated water.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in PVC furnishing vinyl supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Instyle's manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding direct adhesive application to backing foam makes vinyls more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, vinyls should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Instyle's additive-free formulation for vinyls ensures these products are free from PFAS, phthalates, flame retardants, anti-bacterial additives, lead, BPA, TRIS, and formaldehyde, and do not contain conflict minerals. They meet international environmental, health, and safety standards, including California Prop 65, CPSIA, and REACH. Additionally, the formulation achieves reduced energy and water consumption and promotes waste recycling through the use of solution-dyed products. This is supported by our manufacturerâ€™s ISO 14001-certified Environmental Management System.

Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic velour can be recycled through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme either on-site or through one of our local third-party recycling partners: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ (product must be free of adhesives, hardware and contaminants)
recyclable_offcuts_description: Ecoustic Velour offcuts can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: 100% PET (polyethylene terephthalate) is a mono-material that can be mechanically recycled into pellets or flakes for use in textiles, carpets, and nonwoven materials, or moulded into containers and packaging strapping. It can also be chemically recycled and repolymerised into food-grade PET resin for bottles, containers, or high-quality textile fibres comparable to virgin PET. Australia currently lacks commercial-scale chemical reprocessing facilities for plastics, however, so most PET is downcycled into lower-grade composite materials (e.g. foam).
reusable_description: Ecoustic Velour fabric is not designed for disassembly; however, it still aligns with Instyleâ€™s commitment to material efficiency. Unlike our other Ecoustic panels, which can be installed with aluminium and cable hardware to minimise adhesive use, Ecoustic Velour generally requires adhesive-based installation. Please check the terms of Instyle's REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme for takeback applicability.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic velour can be returned to Instyle for recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ (product must be free of adhesives, hardware and contaminants)
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The A4 module is not declared, however local manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste, environmental impact and cost can be minimised by designing with roll size in mind. It is advisable to design components in dimensions that maximise the yield of both roll width and length. The Instyle Ecoustic design team can help with efficient yield component sizes for our panel products using Ecoustic Velour.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights risks in PET supply chains arise mainly in the polymer processing stage, where workers can be exposed to harmful VOCs and antimony, a toxic substance used as a catalyst. These conditions necessitate stringent safety measures to protect workers' health and rights. These risks are minimised due to strict Australia labour laws, and as qualified by the product's Declare and Global Greentag Level A certifications.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: Acoustic PET panels can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible recycling through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic Velour fabric is not designed for disassembly; however, it still aligns with Instyleâ€™s commitment to material efficiency. Unlike our other Ecoustic panels, which can be installed with aluminium and cable hardware to minimise adhesive use, Ecoustic Velour generally requires adhesive-based installation. Please check the terms of Instyle's REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme for takeback applicability. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Please note that kgCO2eq value varies depending panel thicknesses â€“ an average has been provided. Refer to EPD for full breakdown. Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: LIFE Textiles can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme.
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: High-performance textiles can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme, however conditions of return apply for these materials as there is currently limited recycling capability for bonded and PU-backed textiles in Australia. Visit https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/ for more information.
water_reduction_techniques: Manufacturing facilities use a mix of rain-fed and recirculated water.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise fabric usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the textile and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks can be prevalent in synthetic textile supply chains, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labour laws. Additionally, there are risks of toxic chemical use, environmental pollution, and reliance on fossil fuels. Our manufacturer operates under strict labour regulations and adheres to high social & environmental standards, ensuring fair treatment of workers and reducing these risks significantly.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While high-performance textiles offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however high-performance textiles can still release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways for these textiles through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate these potential impacts.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding direct adhesive application to backing foam makes high-performance textiles more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, these textiles should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Instyle's reduced toxicity formulation for high-performance textiles ensures these products are free from PFAS, PFCs, phthalates, flame retardants, anti-bacterial additives, lead, BPA, TRIS, and formaldehyde, and do not contain conflict minerals. They meet international environmental, health, and safety standards, including California Prop 65, CPSIA, and REACH. This is supported by our manufacturerâ€™s ISO 14001-certified Environmental Management System.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Tannery uses a biological Water Treatment Plant, utilising 100% non-potable river water in a closed-loop process that purifies the water before returning it to the source.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific policies are in place to reduce transport emissions, however all hides are sourced regionally in Europe and processing is in a vertical facility which significantly reduces transport distance between hubs.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any leather, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise hide usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the leather and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are significant concerns in the leather supply chain, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labor laws. The Leather Working Group (LWG) provides a framework for auditing and certifying tanneries based on their adherence to social and environmental standards, helping to ensure responsible sourcing and production practices. By requiring compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, LWG certifications provide assurances of fair treatment for workers and efforts to mitigate toxic chemical use and environmental pollution. As global leaders in sustainable leather production, our European partner Elmo sets high standards to actively reducing risks and promote safe practices throughout the leather supply chain.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Elmo prioritises sustainability through several significant initiatives. Their "Zero Waste Leather" concept ensures that all production waste is upcycled, recycled, or reused, creating a circular economy with no waste sent to landfills. The Elmo Circular Operating model (ECO) enhances resource efficiency and reduces environmental impact by repurposing all process waste as raw materials or energy sources. Elmo has achieved CO2 neutrality in energy use by utilising 100% renewable electricity and biofuel-based steam for heating. They enhance sustainability further by implementing a circular heating energy approach, selling back the hot condensate generated from biofuel steam to the heating supplier, which reduces energy consumption in steam production. For more detailed information, visit their website.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments:
Elmo prioritises sustainability through several significant initiatives. Their "Zero Waste Leather" concept ensures that all production waste is upcycled, recycled, or reused, creating a circular economy with no waste sent to landfills. The Elmo Circular Operating model (ECO) enhances resource efficiency and reduces environmental impact by repurposing all process waste as raw materials or energy sources. Elmo has achieved CO2 neutrality in energy use by utilising 100% renewable electricity and biofuel-based steam for heating. They enhance sustainability further by implementing a circular heating energy approach, selling back the hot condensate generated from biofuel steam to the heating supplier, which reduces energy consumption in steam production. For more detailed information, visit their website.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

recyclable_offcuts_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Tannery uses a biological Water Treatment Plant, utilising 100% non-potable river water in a closed-loop process that purifies the water before returning it to the source.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific policies are in place to reduce transport emissions, however all hides are sourced regionally in Europe and processing is in a vertical facility which significantly reduces transport distance between hubs.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any leather, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise hide usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the leather and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are significant concerns in the leather supply chain, often involving exploitative labour practices and poor working conditions in countries with weak labor laws. The Leather Working Group (LWG) provides a framework for auditing and certifying tanneries based on their adherence to social and environmental standards, helping to ensure responsible sourcing and production practices. By requiring compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, LWG certifications provide assurances of fair treatment for workers and efforts to mitigate toxic chemical use and environmental pollution. As global leaders in sustainable leather production, our European partner Elmo sets high standards to actively reducing risks and promote safe practices throughout the leather supply chain.

recyclable_percentage_description: All of Instyle's pure wool LIFE Textiles are inherently renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. They can be returned to Instyle for responsible recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recycling_process_description: Wool textiles can be shredded and either re-spun into blended yarns in a textile-to-textile recycling process, or downcycled into lower grade aggregate products.
end_of_life_program_description: Leathers can be returned to Instyle for re-circulation through our REVIVEÂ® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Tannery complies with the stringent requirements and high standards set forth by EU legislation regarding water consumption and other resource use. No specific measures are in place for capturing rainwater or recycled water.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: No specific policies are in place to reduce transport emissions, however all hides are both sourced and processed in Western Europe, which significantly reduces the need for air and sea transport between hubs.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and wastage with any leather, use precise measurements and cutting techniques, and design patterns to maximise hide usage. Work with a professional upholsterer who understands the characteristics and performance of the leather and can provide an accurate material requirement. The Instyle design team can help with efficient yield guidance for your project.
modern_slavery_action_plan_comment: Communicating directly with the supplier to establish Corrective Action Plans that focused on implementing processes and procedures, retraining staff, and establishing policies so that all risks, low to high, can be monitored, responded to and eliminated.
modern_slavery_comments: Human rights and modern slavery risks are major concerns in global leather supply chains, particularly in regions with weaker labour protections, where exploitative practices and poor working conditions are prevalent. High standards in the European Union support auditing and certification frameworks to ensure compliance with strict labour regulations and environmental policies, promoting fair treatment, safe working environments, and efforts to reduce toxic chemical use. Our European leather partner lead the way in mitigating these risks, as evidenced by the Leather Working Group Gold certification.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: While soft furnishing PVC materials offer durability, versatility and longevity, they require management to reduce risks throughout their lifecycle. Instyle's manufacturer is REACH, RoHS + Bluesign compliant, however vinyls can still produce harmful emissions during manufacturing. Instyle is working on developing responsible recirculation pathways through our REVIVE product stewardship scheme to help mitigate potential environmental impacts at end-of-life.
specific_installation_methods: Avoiding any direct adhesive application to backing foam makes leathers more suitable for end-of-life stewardship. Ideally, leathers should be reused as part of the original furnishing structure to maximise their lifespan and sustainability.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request â€“ please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.

compliance_requirements.rating: Ignitability 11, Flame Spread 0, Heat Evolved 3, Smoke Developed 6

other_comments:
Puretann uses only the finest European raw hides. They are tanned exclusively with extracts from pods of the Tara tree, grown in the temperate climate of the Peruvian Andes. The pods are cultivated in a way that does not damage the trees thus minimising any damage to the environment. No chromium or synthetic tanning agents are used, just pure vegetable extracts, giving an unbelievably soft, luxurious feel and appearance. As a Pure Aniline of the highest quality, PuretannÂ® will exhibit all of nature's marks.

recyclable_offcuts_description: There are two avenues available: 1) Upcycling waste from leather manufacturing and/or upholstery processes, where the off-cuts can be sold to accessories manufacturers who use those off-cuts for things pike bags or wallets (Cortina waste goes this route), or 2) Recycled leather from furniture which is used to make bonded leather, where itâ€™s ground up and mixed with adhesives and bonding agents to manufacture bonded leather for things like belts and bags.
recycling_process_description: See above
compostable_conditions: Leather is biodegradable but itâ€™s difficult to put %â€™s on, as the different types of leather and then also different types of finishing chemicals affect the timeline. Veg-tanned leathers will biodegrade in 6-12 months.  Then, chrome-tanned leathers vary â€“ with pure anilines, those not having pigment on their surface perhaps taking between 5-10 years, and pigmented -finish articles maybe taking up to 50-100 years.  But if weâ€™re looking at landfills and the different types, that will also have an effect.  Any landfill which allows air and moisture to reach the leather material will accelerate or at least mean biodegrading happens most quickly, but if the leather were deep in a landfill, and not being subjected to much air or moisture that leather would only biodegrade extremely slowly.
reusable_description: There are two avenues available: 1) Upcycling waste from leather manufacturing and/or upholstery processes, where the off-cuts can be sold to accessories manufacturers who use those off-cuts for things pike bags or wallets (Cortina waste goes this route), or 2) Recycled leather from furniture which is used to make bonded leather, where itâ€™s ground up and mixed with adhesives and bonding agents to manufacture bonded leather for things like belts and bags.
water_reduction_techniques: N/a

Textile23 fabrics are designed with human, climate, and social health in mind. Being 100% wool, they are naturally renewable, biodegradable, and free from intentionally added PFAS, FR chemicals, and hydrolysed formaldehyde, supporting healthy indoor air quality and safer environments.

Our products are developed through collaboration with Australian and New Zealand designers, supporting local creative industries, and all manufacturing practices emphasise circularity, which includes repurposing fabric remnants for sample cards and reusing fabric cores with our partners. By reducing waste, extending material life, and prioritising traceable, responsibly sourced fibres, Textile23 contributes to climate-conscious, socially responsible, and equitable design solutions for commercial, residential, and hospitality interiors.

At Textile23, we are committed to minimizing the environmental impact of our packaging. Fabrics are transported using heavyweight plastic wrapping and cardboard cores, which are reused and recycled wherever possible in collaboration with our manufacturing partners. By repurposing fabric cores and saving packaging materials for multiple cycles, we significantly reduce waste and extend the life of our transport materials.

We are actively exploring opportunities to further increase the recycled content of our packaging and identify alternatives that align with our commitment to circularity, responsible sourcing, and sustainability throughout the supply chain.

recyclable_offcuts_description: Crypton maintains an ongoing recycling program of manufacturing remnants. And locally, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group). It would need to be the upholsterer / workroom that builds their own local partnership for this.
water_reduction_techniques: Unsure
minimisation_design_strategy: N/a
specific_installation_methods: No adhesives or staples
other_comments:
Yarn is most often bought on the spot market so we can only provide details of the country of manufacture i.e. where the base cloth is milled. And in the case of Crypton, we are only allowed to detail their Head Office and main mill in the US.
Crypton is a company very committed to sustainability. You can read their Eco Statement and see more information here: https://materialised.com.au/crypton-waterproof-fabric/
You can learn about our sustainability statement and practices here: https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/
This is a link to our internal Waste Warriors team, list of charities we donate to: https://materialised.com.au/sustainability/recycling-charities/
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores and clear plastic wrap. Pallets are used if the quantity is large.

product_description: A printable, finely textured base cloth with a waterproof backing. Antimicrobial and soil repellent.
recyclable_percentage_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recyclable_offcuts_description: This product can be recycled through various programs in Australia, such as TRG, as long as it is uncontaminated i.e. no staples, hooks or adhesives.
recycling_process_description: We recycle unusable offcuts with onshore Textile Recyclers Group where it is made back into recycled yarn
water_reduction_techniques: Our digital print facilities uses little to no water.
minimisation_design_strategy: We print on demand so there is very little wastage. What can be reused is picked up by our local charity partners. And we have a recycling program with TRG where unusable offcuts are recycled back into yarn.
factory_finished_description: Printing of designs onto the textile substrate involves dye sublimation, the initial stage of which is printing the design onto FSC certified paper, using OEKO-TEX ECO PASSPORT certified inks.
other_comments:

product_description: Metallised 4% openness fabric with high solar reflectance and thermal insulation
recyclable_percentage_description:
95-100%- 
We recycled all of our 205 SilverScreen performance off-cuts via in-house sampling, and remaining or returned fabrics via take-back program are recycled via conversion into alternate fuels for industry
reusable_description: The fabric can be reused and or recycled
end_of_life_program_description: Verosol have a product stewardship and take-back program
water_reduction_techniques: Unsure
minimisation_design_strategy: Manufactured into custom widths to avoid wastage
risk_of_harm_posed_description:
95-100%
We recycled all of our Crypton offcuts and sampling by partnering with Textile Recyclers Group at their recycling depot in Sydney. They recycle back into yarn.
other_comments:
Verosolâ€™s approach to Product Stewardship is comprehensive. It includes minimising the carbon footprints of all our offices and 
manufacturing facilities; the development of a Product Take Back Program; a Waste to Energy Program; Waste Recycling Programs 
at our facilities in the Netherlands and Australia; regulatory compliance in all countries in which we operate; responsible sourcing 
of materials; and concerted efforts in terms of Material Re-Use and Product Conversion.
i) Carbon Footprint Reduction
Acknowledging the significant contribution that poor manufacturing practices can make to greenhouse emissions, we make every 
effort to ensure our manufacturing facilities in Australia and the Netherlands are as efficient as possible. Our efforts to reduce 
operational carbon include the installation of rooftop solar cells at our plants in Sydney and The Netherlands, and the installation 
of LED lighting in our Sydney plant and office..
Our Australian production facility in 2023, has moved beyond climate neutral goals becoming carbon positive with the expansion
of the existing solar panel system. The facility now produces a large surplus of renewable energy, offsetting more energy than the
site consumes.
For more information visit: https://verosol.com.au/product-stewardship/
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores and clear plastic wrap. Pallets and cardboard boxes are used for large volumes

product_description: A contemporary, daring and versatile real leather, protected with Crypton
recyclable_percentage_description: See above
recyclable_offcuts_description: There are two avenues available: 1) Upcycling waste from leather manufacturing and/or upholstery processes, where the off-cuts can be sold to accessories manufacturers who use those off-cuts for things pike bags or wallets (Cortina waste goes this route), or 2) Recycled leather from furniture which is used to make bonded leather, where itâ€™s ground up and mixed with adhesives and bonding agents to manufacture bonded leather for things like belts and bags.
recycling_process_description: See above
compostable_conditions: Leather is biodegradable but itâ€™s difficult to put %â€™s on, as the different types of leather and then also different types of finishing chemicals affect the timeline. Veg-tanned leathers will biodegrade in 6-12 months.  Then, chrome-tanned leathers vary â€“ with pure anilines, those not having pigment on their surface perhaps taking between 5-10 years, and pigmented -finish articles maybe taking up to 50-100 years.  But if weâ€™re looking at landfills and the different types, that will also have an effect.  Any landfill which allows air and moisture to reach the leather material will accelerate or at least mean biodegrading happens most quickly, but if the leather were deep in a landfill, and not being subjected to much air or moisture that leather would only biodegrade extremely slowly.
reusable_description: There are two avenues available: 1) Upcycling waste from leather manufacturing and/or upholstery processes, where the off-cuts can be sold to accessories manufacturers who use those off-cuts for things pike bags or wallets (Cortina waste goes this route), or 2) Recycled leather from furniture which is used to make bonded leather, where itâ€™s ground up and mixed with adhesives and bonding agents to manufacture bonded leather for things like belts and bags.
water_reduction_techniques: N/a
minimisation_design_strategy: We carefully select the closest sized hide to meet your requirements
other_comments:
Additional Safety & Compliance info for Crypton Leather:
Free of fluoride, C6, PFAs, or PFOAs
Free of PBA, PVC, Phthalates, or elastomers
Free of heavy metals or silver
Free of conflict minerals
SCS certified for ultra-low VOCs to meet LEED certification requirements
Compliant with stringent European REACH standards
Cleared from California Prop 65 warning
type_of_packaging: Recycled cardboard boxes

water_reduction_techniques: The Italian based manufacturer of our High Performance/Outdoor fabric minimises the use of public potable water supply through a dedicated water well on-site.
minimisation_design_strategy:
Our fabrics are printed to order to reduce over production and wastage.

To minimise offcuts and wastage with any textile, we appreciate precise measurements and encourage economical pattern design and cutting techniques to maximise fabric usage.

manufacturing_locations.location_name: Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

material_locations.location_name: Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

other_comments:
High Performance / Outdoor is a premium fabric for high traffic interiors and exteriors. With excellent abrasion resistance and the ability to be bleach cleaned, this fabric is suitable for upholstery applications in educational and hospitality settings, as well as public spaces. Strong UV tolerance and water, chlorine and salt resistance make it perfect for outdoor upholstery and soft furnishings.


Established in Naarm (Melbourne) in 2015 by two non-Indigenous art curators, Willie Weston is the first and only textile brand working exclusively with Australian First Nations artists to create textiles, wallpapers and other products for commercial interiors. Sourcing sophisticated and diverse artworks from First Nations artists across Australia, we delicately translate these works into contemporary designs.
type_of_packaging: Willie Weston are currently exploring options for a biodegradable plastic wrap to package rolls of fabric for distribution. We use a 'Global Green Tag' verified biodegradable plastic tape for all our packaging. We recycle soft plastic packaging that we receive from suppliers and mills through Reground.

product_description: Beautiful ombre designs printed in Sydney on Brooklyn White / Char sheer fabric
recyclable_percentage_description: Yes, we have a recycling program through our internal Waste Warriors team. Everything is separated to be upcycled / reused through local charities or recycled through TRG (Textile Recyclers Group).
recyclable_offcuts_description: This product can be recycled through various programs in Australia, such as TRG, as long as it is uncontaminated i.e. no staples, hooks or adhesives.
recycling_process_description: We recycle unusable offcuts with onshore Textile Recyclers Group where it is made back into recycled yarn
water_reduction_techniques: Our digital print facilities uses little to no water.
minimisation_design_strategy: We print on demand so there is very little wastage. What can be reused is picked up by our local charity partners. And we have a recycling program with TRG where unusable offcuts are recycled back into yarn.
factory_finished_description: Printing of designs onto the textile substrate involves dye sublimation, the initial stage of which is printing the design onto FSC certified paper, using OEKO-TEX ECO PASSPORT certified inks.
